frameDefinitions: Words in this frame name the different parts of the calendric cycle, both man-made and natural.
An Executioner punishes an individual (Executed) with death as a consequence of some action of the Evaluee (the Reason).
A stretch of linguistic discourse or a Text that a Communicator produces has a Topic that it is about.
This frame is for words that denote highly schematic entities.
This frame involves a Donor transferring a Theme to a Recipient.
An Agent, which may be an individual or group, is engaged in a complex Activity.
frameExamples: Jo's mother will visit on this coming <t>Tuesday</t>.
We found an unusual wooden <t>object</t> in the desert.
The New Car Assessment <t>Program</t> (NCAP) is dedicated to helping the public buy a safer car.
listRoleDefinitions: <fen>Relative_time</fen> is used for the word or words that locate the time with respect to an identifiable reference point.
<fen>Whole</fen> is used for the larger unit of which the target word names a part.
The calendric unit that is denoted. LUs in this frame all denote the <fen>Unit</fen>.
The <fen>Executioner</fen> is the individual who performs the execution.
The <fen>Executed</fen> is the person who is killed by the <fen>Executioner</fen> in retribution for the crime that the <fen>Executed</fen> was convicted of.
When the execution occurs.
Where the execution takes place.
The <fen>Topic</fen> is what a <fen>Text</fen> is about.
A set of propositions that is coherent in being about a <fen>Topic</fen>
The <fen>Communicator</fen> is the person who has produced a <fen>Text</fen> on a <fen>Topic</fen>.
The time at which the <fen>Communicator</fen> produces <fen>Text</fen> on a <fen>Topic</fen>.
A thing (either abstract or physical) that exists with some degree of permanence.
The entity that ends up in possession of the Theme.
The object that changes ownership.
The person that begins in possession of the Theme and causes it to be in the possession of the Recipient.
The <fen>Donor</fen> and <fen>Recipient</fen> conceived of as a unit.
When the transfer occurs.
Where the event takes place.
The individual or organization that carries out the project.
An area of human endeavor, typically scientifc in nature, in which the <fen>Agent</fen>'s <fen>Activity</fen> falls.
What the <fen>Agent</fen> (an individual or the members of an organization) are dedicated to doing.
The larger aim that the <fen>Agent</fen> is pursuing by carrying out certain coordinated measures.
An entity (abstract or concrete) which is involved in an implicit <fen>Activity</fen>.
The ongoing plan of action which allows the <fen>Agent</fen> to pursue the <fen>Activity</fen>.
The time at which the <fen>Project</fen> is ongoing.
The location where a <fen>Project</fen> is pursued.
listRoleExamples: Jo's mother will visit <fex> this coming</fex> Tuesday.
Jo fled in the early morning <fex>of  Sunday December 15</fex>.
The truth is, <fex>we</fex> have all put them to death.
<fex>He</fex> was to be hanged in the morning.
In his book, <fex>Smithers</fex> discusses cotton production.
The <fex>DOE</fex> Human Genome Program also has developed high-throughput approaches to identifying is-regulatory sequences in the human and other genomes
Several projects <fex>in computational linguistics</fex> have recently stalled due to lack of funding .
The <fex>New Car Assessment</fex> Program (NCAP) is dedicated to helping the public buy a safer car.
The program <fex>to analyze the composition of Titan's sludge</fex> is nearly complete.
Iran has vowed to continue its <fex>nuclear</fex> program and is demanding that sanctions against it should be lifted .
